definition: there are no poor soldiers under a good general (idiom)

variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
to desire/to invite/to request

to have real skill/to know one's stuff
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
